poem:
**Picking Up the Pieces**

Under brambles, crisp foil flutters,   
half-eaten by earth's grim embrace.   
Each grip tears, fragment by fragment—  
small jagged hope in my bin liner.  

With every snag, resolve renews;  
beneath these troubled, mucky skies,  
we mend the world, one gleaming shard,  
and move on, undeterred.
